page.title: 14OUR WOODLANDS.
page.content: All of this area was thickly wooded in ancient times:the Romans called it the{Great Forest of Anderida}and the 11 woods in the survey region are probably descendants of that earlier forest.They are all privately owned except for{Park Wood}owned by the {Forestry Commission. Most of the woodland is{mixed {deciduous};oak,beech,hazel,birch, hornbeam and sweet chestnut(which was planted for coppicing)are commonly found in this area. Under the trees are usually brambles and honeysuckle near the path edges.Bluebells,primroses,wood anemone and violets grow where the light is strong enough. The woodlands are{habitats}for mice,voles,weasels,squirrels,hedgehogs ,badgers,butterflies and birds.A few deer may have strayed in from outside.
